abstract: The investing arms of Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley are working on a $15 billion private-equity play for the oil-and-gas assets of the utility company Dominion Resources, The Wall Street Journal reported. Goldman and Morgan are said to be part of a consortium that includes the buyout shop Madison Dearborn Partners, Warburg Pincus, First Reserve and the Carlyle Group and its affiliate Riverstone Holdings. The Journal said that it may end up bidding against a rival consortium, made up of Blackstone Group, Texas Pacific Group and Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, which is also exploring an offer.
lead_paragraph: The investing arms of Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley are working on a $15 billion private-equity play for the oil-and-gas assets of the utility company Dominion Resources, The Wall Street Journal reported. Goldman and Morgan are said to be part of a consortium that includes the buyout shop Madison Dearborn Partners, Warburg Pincus, First Reserve and the Carlyle Group and its affiliate Riverstone Holdings. The Journal said that it may end up bidding against a rival consortium, made up of Blackstone Group, Texas Pacific Group and Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, which is also exploring an offer.

headline.main: Goldman and Morgan Eye Dominion Bid, Report Says
